gurmukhi: jIvq jy jg mY rih hY Aiq ju`D kQw hnrI suin lYhY ] qwN Cib kI kivqw kir kY kib rwm nrySn jwie irJY hY ]
transliteration: Jeevat Je Jag Mai Rah(i) Hai At(i0 Juddh Kathaadhamrisoun(i) Laihai|| Tan Chhab(i) Kavitaa Kar(i) Kabi Raam Dareshan Jaae Rijhai Hai||
translation: “Those who will survive in the world, they will listen to our war episode and the poets will please the kings with that poetry;

gurmukhi: jo bl pY kih hY kQ pMifq rIJ Gno iqh ko Dn dY hY ] hy hirjU ieh Awhv ky jug cwrin mY gn gMDRb gYhY ]1177]
transliteration: Jo Bal Pai Kah(i) Hai Kath Pandit Reejh Ghano Tih Ko Dhan Dai Hai|| He Har(i)joo Eh Aahav Ke Joug Chaaran(i) Mai Gad Gaddhrab Gadhai||1177||
translation: “But if the Pundits will narrate it, they will also receive enormous wealth; and O Krishna ! Ganas and Gandharvas will also sing about this war.”1177.

gurmukhi: kop kY au`qr dyq BXo Air kI bqIXw sin sXwm sbY ] icrIXw bn mY cuhkY qb lau Aiq kop n Awvq bwj jbY ]
transliteration: Kop Kai Outtar Det Bhayo Ar(i) Kibateeyaa Soun(i) Syaam Sabai|| Chireeyaa Ban Mai Chuhkai Tab Lau At(i) Kop Na Aavat Baaj Jabai||
translation: Krishna heard all this talk of the enemy, got enraged, and said, “The sparrow only chirps in the forest as long as the falcon does not come there;

gurmukhi: grbwq hY mUF Gno rn mY kithO quih sIs lKYgo qbY ] iqh qy qij SMk inSMk lro blbIr khXo khwN FIl AbY ]1178]
transliteration: Gadbaat Hai Moondh Ghano Ran Mai Kaatteehau Tuh(i) Sees Lakhaigo Tabai|| Tih Te Taj(i) Shank Nishank Daro Balbeer Kahyo Kahaan Dheel Abai||1178||
translation: “O fool, you are absorbed in too much pride; you will know only then, when I chop your head; therefore forsaking all illusions come and fight and do not delay any more.”1178.

gurmukhi: XoN suin kY kit bYnn ko Aclys blI mn kop jgXo ] ks bolq ho kCu lwj gho rn TwFy rho suinho n pgXo ]
transliteration: Yon Soun(i) Kai Mattee Bainan Ko Achles Baliman Kop Jagyo Kas Dolat Ho Kachhu Laaj Gado Ran Thaadhe Raho Souniho Na Pagyo||
translation: Hearing these words, the anger arose in the mind of the brave Achal Singh and he thundered,

gurmukhi: Xh auqr dY hir ko jbhI qbhI inj AwXuD lY aumgXo ] mn mY hrKXo Dn ko krKXo brKXo sr sRI hir kau n lgXo ]1179]
transliteration: Yah Outar Dai Har(i) Ko Jab-hitab-hinij Aayudh Lai Oumagyo|| Man Mai Barkhyo Dhan Ko Karkhyo Barkhyo Sar Srihar(i) Kau Na Lagyo||1179||
translation: “O Krishna ! you may feel ashamed; stand there and do not run;” saying this he held up his weapon in his hand and ran forward; he, getting pleased, pulled his bow and discharged his arrow, but that arrow did not hit Krishna.1179.

gurmukhi: jo Aclys jU bwn clwvq so hir Awvq kwit igrwvY ] jwnY n dyh lgXo Ar kI sr Pyr irsw kir Aaur clwvY ]
transliteration: Jo Achles Joo Baan Chadaavat So Har(i) Giraavai|| Jaanai Na Dh Lagyo Ar Kisar Pher Risaa Risaa Kar(i) Aur Chalaavai||
translation: Every arrow discharged by Achal Singh was intercepted by Krishna; when he learnt that, that arrow did not hit Krishna, then in anger he would shoot another arrow;

gurmukhi: so hir Awvq bIc ktY Apno auhky aur bIc lgwvY ] dyK sq`kiRq kauqk kO kib rwm khY pRB ko jsu gwvY ]1180]
transliteration: So Har(i) Aavat Beech Katai Apno Uhke Ur Beech Lagadvai|| Dekh Satakkril Kaoutak Kau Kabi Raam Kabai Prbh Ko Jas(u) Gadvai||1180||
translation: Krishna would intercept that arrow also midway and instead would inflict his arrow in his enemy’s chest; seeing this spectacle, the poet Ram is eulogsing the Lord-God.1180.
